comment: Professor Graham was easily one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw State. He gives a few tests that aren't too hard, and every week you have a short analysis due. At the beginning of the semester it seemed like a lot, but the assignments are insanely easy, and I ended up with an A in the class. I HIGHLY recommend taking him!

Professor Graham is the coolest professor I have ever had, and his sense of humor is awesome! His class is very philosophy based, but it is very interesting. The environment of his class is so chill and welcoming, and I always looked forward to attending. I would definitely recommend him! Also, no tests!

TAKE HIM! I can't stress this enough. He is one of the best professor's i've had here at Kennesaw. I was a little nervous at first because the class does seem a bit unorganized but that quickly went away once I got into the flow of his class. The assignments aren't hard, content is interesting (including his book) and he actually cares about you!

Professor Graham is so kind and cares about all of his students. He makes the class super interesting and makes it easy to get a good grade. You have to write an analysis paper weekly but he talks about each of the books during class so you don't have to read at home, but you write your opinion on each book and the paper is only one page, easy 100.

Weekly papers on that week's reading (very easy only one-page, and you write about your opinion). No textbook but you do have to buy a few different books/pamphlets for class. Class is advertised as "World Literature" but it actually emphasizes poetry in the middle east/Asia. Easiest A ever, really chill professor, would definitely recommend him.

Super sweet and genuine man, this alone makes you want to work hard in his class. Weekly analysis of poems, but super easy. Attendance was mandatory first few weeks, but slowly stopped. Gives you study guides which are basically answer sheets to the test. Extra credit opportunity, and accepted late work. Definitely recommend for sure!
This professor is great! You have a lot of short papers but theyre easy! If you do the work youll get an A, hes super nice and funny and helps you with everything including giving study guides

Hes not the most organized professor but he knows a TON about what he is teaching and makes up for it with depth of knowledge& making stuff relatable. He CARES about his students and will go out of his way to help anyone w/ ANYTHING even if its for another class. We read some of his  poetry for class too, & its legit & actually understandable!!

Professor Graham has the biggest heart of anyone I have ever met. I recommend him for all classes that he teaches He is understanding and goes above and beyond to make his students understand. I would take him again in a heart beat.

One of the most selfless professors I have ever had. He always puts his family first, then his students, then himself. He's very forgiving of one's circumstances and will happily work with anyone to help them get the best grade possible.

Great prof. Hybrid class. Few essays, most of the grades are basically completion grades. He brings profound topics to the table. the largest word count you'll have is 5-7 pages, whereas the rest are 2-4. Take him!

He was an amazing prof! I am a terrible writer but I got a B. there are several small papers and then 1 big one(5-8pgs) which was fun to write actually. make inclass lectures fun (when I knew what he was taking about lol). I took his hybrid class. Id take him again 100%! and you don't need ANY of the books listed

Professor graham was an incredible professor even for his online students. Most assignments were explained through youtube videos and he always answered any questions. (even if he was very late) He's a very understanding man, especially for his online students and if I have the option, I will DEFINITELY take him again. TAKE HIM YOU WONT REGRET IT!!

Easy online class. Simple weekly argument flows and reading discussion questions. Essays here and there. He is somewhat disorganized throughout the entire semester. Uploads necessary documents a day before it's due and D2L is kinda messy, but grades easy. 100's for all weekly stuff usually if you just do it. Very passionate tho. cool guy.

I am currently taking Professor Graham's online English 1102 class. Though I don't like 100% online classes, Graham makes it worth it. He doesn't assign an excessive amount of work and he grades super easily. If you actually put in a little effort to the assignments, youll be just fine.

A little unorganized, but still my favorite professor! Really cares about you and your grades, and wants to help you become a better writer. He made us vegan cookies for our final (which was showing up and talking about a paper we wrote)

I took this class as a hybrid! Although this class was pretty easy to pass, the material was very complex for a composition class and the lecture was boring and hard to follow. The professor is extremely smart, but it is hard to pick up what he's attempting to put down. There are no exams, but there is a lot of essays and a large group project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved Prof. Graham!!! Hes so funny and really cares about this class. He is always there for you if you need any help at all. Wish I could take him again! Easy A!!!

He doesn't grade you papers on grammar and punctuation, but on ideas and content. So as long as you can write these papers and show some sort of interest in them, you'll get an A. There a couple mini essays at the beginning of the semester than the rest of the course is devoted to working on your 'main' proposal essay. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!

Professor Graham is an incredible professor. He is really understanding, engaging, and enthusiastic about the class. He cares deeply about his students, their ideas, and making sure their voices are heard. The coursework is both effective- no busy work and easy. Very easy to talk to, great feedback and easy gradings! 10/10 would take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Graham is absolutely one of the best instructors I have ever had. He cares more about your ideas than he does punctuation. His assignments are useful and reasonable. He is also flexible with deadlines for certain situations. Very easy to talk to, gives great feedback and really wants to see his students succeed!

Honestly one of the nicest and coolest teachers i've ever had. He's always willing to work with you and give feedback on essays prior to the due date so every essay has been an easy A. However, he is a super smart guy and his lectures can be super hard to follow bc everything he says is philosophy based. You're definitely gonna have to read.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: have him for a hybrid rn, great guy, passionate about what he's teaching but I didn't know this class was gonna be apparently philosophy based? If you don't like talking about Socrates and stuff like that, wouldn't recommend because that's all he talks about Not too bad though, assignments were more like completion, essays & 1 group project

Amazing! Must take! Great feedback and really actually cares! Turn in all of your assignments, and come to class, you're basically guaranteed an A. There are no tests, it's all essays. The final is a portfolio of all of your previous essays

He actually teaches people how to write-- not with prepackaged essays chosen by someone else  on "rhetorical communities" or "speech acts" with "10 reading questions" after each one. You write about stuff you care about and he helps you be the best writer you can be,  he'll develop your writing style & gives the best feedback & cared about students

Professor Graham is my favorite professor I've taken anywhere. He is passionate about English and teaching. He cares for his students and gives plenty of helpful feedback on papers. He is a grammar beast. I enjoyed his class very much and would love to take him again. If you get the chance def take his class. Flexible with deadlines. Brillant.

Easy class to pass if you show up and turn things in. He takes time to explain everything and answers any questions anyone has. He gives workshop days for the writing assignments where you can get help one on one with him during class and his feedback and comments are SUPER in depth and helpful.
super easy A. Have him now, and he does not give too many assignments. He will take the time to make sure everyone understands,and he is not super strict about due dates. Would definitely take again.

Really cares about what he's teaching and knows a lot about everything. Is super helpful--even if you don't understand something he'll take the time to make sure everyone gets it. His handwriting is unreadable like totally don't even look like any language that exists. But he knows it and so he types stuff out now--it's actually pretty hilarious.
he is so lit omg
